data.title: Delete word forward/backward

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code Insiders
- OS Version: latest OS X

On Mac, a common shortcut across the OS is alt+backspace to delete backwards a word and alt+fn+backspace to delete forwards a word. However, this does not work in vscode.

data.title: vscode locking down folders
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 insider (Commit: 4d0b2f)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a git repo.
2. Copy a folder and paste it, then open any file in it and close the file.
3. Then try to rename or delete the folder.
4. Fails to delete/rename the folder.

I've made a GIF illustrating this bug. It might be related to vscode doing a git-status regularly as mentioned by @joaomoreno in #901 and #7963, but I'm not sure yet.
Also, this happens almost every single time, and the only way I've found is to close vscode, and go to the directory location and manually delete/rename it.

I also have webpack in my project, but this bug occurs with or without webpack actually running.

![vscode-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/760112/16901521/2cabfde6-4c64-11e6-8acd-b6f5c448b76e.gif)

data.title: Go to definition should not always put line in center
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.4.0-insider (commit 4d0b2f5)
- OS Version:Windows 7 x64

This is rather an ergonomy improvement request:
Currently, it is irritating that Ctrl+LMouse always makes the editor scroll the text to ensure that the jumped-to function declaration is in the middle of the editor area. Instead, the 'going to the declaration' should only apply the least amount of scrolling that is necessary to see the function declaration.
This means, that, if the function is already visible (just the user does not see it immediately), there should not be any scrolling applied, but just the jumped-to function declaration highlighted.
As it is currently, the scrolling is very irritating to the eyes of the user because he loses orientation, when in fact the jumped-to function declaration was just ten lines from the call site.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write a simple function A
2. Call that function from callsite C, which is just 15 - 20 lines away from A's declaration
3. Make sure that both A's declaration and C are visible in the editor area and there is sufficient lines to scroll up/down
4. Ctrl+LMouse click on C
5. Observe that the editor applies unnecessary scrolling, which disorientates the user, because A was already visible

data.title: Code prediction fails in Windows for C++ even after using extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.1
- OS Version:Windows 10 build 10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I have included a bits directory inside the Microsoft Visual Studio official include directory. This bits directory is just a copy from the minGW source.
   The purpose of the directory is that it contains the useful stdc++.h header file
2. But after doing so even though the editor shows no problem in including the files but it is not showing the functions of vectors or other data structures. There is no suggestion for code completion.

(I have clang installed so there is no issue because of clang) 

Also instead of using 'bits/stdc++.h' if I just use 'vector' the code prediction works fine.

Please look into it it's urgent.

data.title: VS Code does not play nicely with Git Bash for Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.10586

Frequently when I open a repository in VSCode and do some kind of operation from the command-line in [Git Bash](https://git-for-windows.github.io/), such as `git rebase`, `git commit`, etc. I will get this error message:

```
fatal: Unable to create 'C:/Users/James/Code/git/coreclr/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
```

Sometimes this conflict will mess up local changes I've made (e.g. once it caused Git to skip 2 commits while I was rebasing), which means I had to force-pull everything from the remote and start all over again.

The thing that's kind of strange about it is when I do a `rm .git/index.lock`, most of the times the file will no longer be present; it appears spontaneously _only_ when I try to run a Git command from the terminal. Re-running the command once or twice seems to get rid of the error most of the time; however sometimes the `index.lock` file stays and I have to manually remove it.

Unfortunately, I wasn't able to get a consistent repro for this since it seems to only occur randomly when VSCode is open on the repository; but it's never happened after I closed the editor. (I haven't noticed any pattern even though this has been happening to me for months.) Nevertheless, it would be greatly appreciated if someone could take a look into this, even though I can't tell what's causing it.

Thanks! :)

data.title: VSCode Debug C++, breaking point not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.1 
- OS Version:Ubuntu 14.04

I debug an C++ project onUbuntu 14.04. I run cmake to produce an executable file and setting VSCode config file. When I press F5 to debug, the program runs well, but it doesn't stop at breaking point!

my source code is in ${workspaceRoot}/InfiniTAM
executable file is in ${workspaceRoot}/build

My config file:
tasjs.json

{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "echo",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["InfiniTAM!"],
    "showOutput": "always"
}

launch.json

{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "C++ Launch (GDB)",
            "type": "cppdbg",
            "request": "launch",
            "launchOptionType": "Local",
            "targetArchitecture": "x64",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/build/InfiniTAM",
            "args": ["Teddy/calib.txt", "Teddy/Frames/%04i.ppm", "Teddy/Frames/%04i.pgm"],
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/build",
            "environment": [],
            "externalConsole": true
        }
    ]
}

I will be very appriciate if you help me :)

data.title: Extend the Search tab (Search Results) with Context Menu
data.body:
The Search results has no Context Menu entries today. It shows files and lines, but you can only click to expand/collapse the results in file, remove a file from the list and navigate to one of the results (lines in file).

It would be interesting to have the same operations for files, that you can use in the Explorer tab, like `Open on the Side`, `Reveal in Explorer` and so on. And also, open a similar Context Menu API that was added to Explorer tab in vesion 1.3.0.

Thanks in advance

data.title: Editor cannot find ANY modules when files use '.es6' extension.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Fedora 24

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Rename an existing JavaScript file to use the extension '.es6' (e.x. rename 'server.js' to 'server.es6').
2. vscode will complain that every module (both local and node_modules) cannot be found. For example, given the following code:

``` javascript
import Promise from 'bluebird';
import Router from './router.es6';
```

vscode will say that "Cannot find module 'bluebird'" and "Cannot find module './router.es6'. Removing the extension from the import statement (`import Router from './router'`) doesn't fix it.

Screenshot:

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9487468/16897452/b9e45ed0-4b77-11e6-999f-e2ecea7dfe59.png)

My jsconfig.json:

``` json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES6",
    "module": "es2015",
    "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": true,
    "noResolve": true
  }
}
```

Dev Tools Console did not display any warnings or errors, and I created the above screenshot while in --disable-extensions mode.

data.title: Shift + Ctrl + M - Should move focus to errors panel, even if it's already active
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a .cs file
2. Introduce 2 syntax errors that will show up as problems
3. Use Shift + Ctrl + M to navigate to the first error an fix it
4. Attempt to use Shift + Ctrl + M to navigate to the next error

**Result:**
Errors panel is hidden

**Expected Result:**
Errors panel receives focus

data.title: Rename Directory fails after copy

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14390

Steps to Reproduce:
- In the Explorer pane, ctrl-drag a folder to its own parent, creating a copy (parent/foo => parent/foo.1). 
- Select the new folder (foo.1) and press F2 to rename it. Change the name, then press Enter.
  - _VS Code will pop an EPERM._
- Open Windows Explorer to the parent folder and attempt to rename the new folder (foo.1).
  - _This will fail with a message indicating that the folder is being used by another program._
- Close VS Code.
- Try again to rename the folder in Windows Explorer.
  - _This time it works._

data.title: Intellisense broken for large JS projects like cocos2dx-js
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new Cocos2x-JS project following steps on: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x
   For example: cocos new -l js WebGame
2. Open project folder in VS Code.
3. Setup default jsconfig.json which doesn't exclude anything.
4. Ctrl+Space (autocomplete) and Cmd+Click (go to definition) don't work.
5. In ./main.js, try Cmd+Click on cc.view or cc.director. VS Code finds an empty reference to cc in Base64Images.js (var cc = cc || {};) and then can't find anything else in cc like cc.view or cc.director etc...

On opening the same project folder in webstorm, both ctrl+space autocomplete and cmd+click go to definition work as expected. So the problem is not with project or code structure etc.

The Visual Studio team has been working on improving support for Cocos2dx C++ projects.
  https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/vcblog/2016/07/12/cocos2d-x-visual-studio-android-project/

It will be great if VS Code can support intellisense for large javascript projects like Cocos2dx JS.

data.title: Undo/redo does not play well with IMEs

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Build 14388

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Switch to some IME, in my case Sogou Chinese keyboard or Microsoft Chinese keyboard.
2. Type something and undo/redo.

It takes many unnecessary undo/redo operations before I can get to the point of document I want, even if some of them does not seem to change the content of document at all.

data.title: HTML tag matching in php (template) files
data.body: I do not really know if this is a bug or a missing feature but the one thing that keeps me from switching to VS Code is html tag matching in php/template files such as laravel blade files. Please add this feature or fix it if this is a bug, thank you!

data.title: No way to drag & move file/directory to the top-level / project directory when the Files Explorer is filled from top to bottom
data.body:
- VSCode Version: all (including 1.4.0-insider)
- OS Version: OS X 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a project which fills the entire Files Explorer from top to bottom (lots of files & directories)
2. there is now no way to drag&drop to move any file to the top-level / project directory - dragging below or above all the files can only allow dropping on the first or last directory present

Ways to fix:
1. allow dragging files to the project name, which is an always visible UI element
2. add a slight padding to the bottom of the files list in the Files Explorer, so there is always room to drag files out to the top-level after scrolling down
